intro: Lagochilum schiedeanum, commonly known as the Schiedea's rock heath, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
